The submerged portion of the lead strip is visibly coated with a reddish-brown layer of deposited copper, while the solution around it appears slightly less blue and has fine reddish-brown particles settling at the bottom. The upper, unsubmerged part of the lead strip remains its original dull metallic gray color.
